articles.title: Hero Rat Magawa Is Retiring From A Career Of Sniffing Out Land Mines In Cambodia - NPR
articles.description: Magawa is credited with saving lives. The African giant pouched rat has found 71 land mines and 38 items of unexploded ordnance. Now, he has reached retirement age after five years of service.
articles.content:
Magawa is shown here working to detect land mines, a job the animal has done for five years.
APOPO

articles.title: SA soldier killed in 'friendly fire' incident in DRC - SowetanLIVE
articles.description: On Thursday, the South African National Defence Force confirmed that one of its soldiers deployed in the DRC has been killed “in friendly fire” while in operation in Kilia, in the eastern DRC, on Thursday morning.
